content:
I see the issue now. Let's fix the production line:

```python
# First check our inventory
inventory = inspect_inventory()
print(f"Current inventory: {inventory}")

# Place a stone furnace at the end of the belt line
move_to(Position(x=-10.0, y=29.0))
furnace = place_entity(
    Prototype.StoneFurnace,
    position=Position(x=-10.0, y=29.0),
    direction=Direction.UP,
    exact=True
)

if furnace:
    # Add fuel to furnace
    insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace, quantity=5)
    print(f"Placed and fueled furnace at {furnace.position}")

    # Place input inserter to feed furnace from belt
    move_to(Position(x=-10.5, y=28.5))
    input_inserter = place_entity(
        Prototype.BurnerInserter,
        position=Position(x=-10.5, y=28.5),
        direction=Direction.RIGHT,  # Face towards furnace
        exact=True
    )
    
    if input_inserter:
        insert_item(Prototype.Coal, input_inserter, quantity=5)
        print(f"Placed and fueled input inserter at {input_inserter.position}")

# Verify the setup
print(f"Updated inventory: {inspect_inventory()}")
print(f"Current entities: {get_entities()}")

# Check if mining drill needs fuel
drill = get_entity(Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill, Position(x=-11.0, y=25.0))
if drill and (not drill.fuel or len(drill.fuel) == 0):
    insert_item(Prototype.Coal, drill, quantity=5)
    print(f"Added fuel to mining drill at {drill.position}")
